column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 29 Verizon Communications Inc  on Wednesday reasserted that it was not planning to strike any Internet "fast lane" deals that would help some websites load faster than others  in a letter to a top U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee lawmaker.

column4: Visa sees mobile payment as big growth driver
column5: Visa Inc  reported a better-than-expected adjusted quarterly profit and said the mobile payment industry would be "a great driver" for business  sending its shares up nearly 4 percent in extended trading.

column4: China to free clearing market for bank cards
column5: BEIJING China will open up its market for clearing domestic bank card transactions  the cabinet said on Wednesday  in a move that could benefit companies such as Visa Inc  and Mastercard   in a booming market worth over $1 trillion a year.

column4: Visa quarterly profit falls 10 pct on legal provision
column5: Oct 29 Visa Inc  the world's largest credit and debit card company  reported a 10 percent fall in quarterly profit as it set aside $453 million for litigation.

column4: UPDATE 1-Whiting profit beats Street as North Dakota output jumps
column5: Oct 29 Oil and gas producer Whiting Petroleum Corp posted a higher-than-expected quarterly profit on Wednesday as production rose 33 percent at its North Dakota wells.

column4: Whiting's quarterly profit falls 23 percent on lower crude prices
column5: Oct 29 Oil and gas producer Whiting Petroleum Corp said on Wednesday its quarterly profit fell 23 percent  largely due to declining crude prices and rising costs.

column4: Yamana Gold posts big loss on impairment  tax charges
column5: TORONTO  Oct 29 Yamana Gold Inc  reported a big third-quarter net loss on Wednesday  reflecting impairment charges for Brazilian mines and charges related to newly enacted Chilean tax changes.
